headline.main: BERMUDA AND THE WEST INDIES.; Bermuda Potato Crop Its Failure and the Cause Shipping Intelligence Vessels in Distress Arrival of the West India Mail News from Barbados, Jamaica, Demarara, St. Vincent, Antigua and Trinidad.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is no disguising the fact that the potato crop has generally failed this season throughout the Bermudas. Never did crop give promise of greater abundance than this in the early stages of its growth; and perhaps never in the experience of any farmer certainly not within that of any one here has the result of such flattering prospects exhibited a failure ...

headline.main: NEW-JERSEY.; From St. Domingo. EARTHQUAKES ALARMS AND DAMAGE TO PROPERTY.

docs.lead_paragraph: DESTRUCTIVE FIRE IN ORANGE FIVE PERSONS BURNED TO DEATH. Between 4 and 5 o'clock on Monday afternoon a blacksmith shop in Orange, occupied by JONATHAN HOBS, caught fire. The upper part of the building, originally intended for a store room, had been used by HOBS as a dwelling for his family, which consisted of his wife and six children, two of whom were twins, only a few weeks old.

headline.main: FROM UTAH.; MOVEMENTS OF THE MILITARY. FURTHER ABUSES OF THE JUDICIAL POWER JUDGE ECKLES THE MORMON MONTHLY FAST.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is not easy to say whether the Mormons or the Army are most anxious about the movement of troops from the Territory. The Army would be glad to be released from the police duty it has been so long performing, and to be engaged in some more appropriate business than that of waiting idly for a contingency unlikely to occur while it is here to overawe rebellion.

docs.snippet: Our references to the Charleston Convention must hereafter be placed in the dual number; for Charleston has two Conventions, the proceedings of which claim equal attention. The Southern Seceders, who on Monday afternoon bade solemn farewell to their...
docs.lead_paragraph: Our references to the Charleston Convention must hereafter be placed in the dual number; for Charleston has two Conventions, the proceedings of which claim equal attention. The Southern Seceders, who on Monday afternoon bade solemn farewell to their fellows, and, taking up their cross, fashioned, doubtless, after the symbol of the Scottish tutelar Saint, repaired to St. Andrew's ...
